usefulItems: bowl, deep saucepan, slotted spoon, thermal serving bowl or other large bowl, silicone bread mat, stove top
title: Semolina dumplings with mushroom sauce

ingredients.content: 4 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
400 g fresh Swiss brown mushrooms, cut into quarters
fresh chives, finely chopped, for garnishing

preparations.content: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh semolina into it. Set aside.
Place parsley into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Place milk, 30 g of the butter, pepper, nutmeg and ½ teaspoon of the salt into mixing bowl and heat <b>3 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Mix <b>1 min/speed 2<b>, carefully adding reserved semolina through hole in mixing bowl lid. Set aside for 5 minutes to rest, without mixing bowl lid.

Place water and remaining 1 teaspoon salt into a deep saucepan and bring water to the boil. Meanwhile continue with recipe. Add egg yolks to cooled semolina mixture and mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer dough onto a floured silicone bread mat or clean work surface and shape into a ball. Divide into 4 equal portions (approx. 140 g each). Using your hands, roll each portion into a log shape (approx. 20 in length), then cut into pieces (1-2 cm) with aid of spatula.

Working in 2 batches, cook dumplings in boiling water for approx. 5 minutes, until they rise to the surface. Using a slotted spoon, transfer dumplings into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl and cover to keep warm. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place garlic and eschalots into mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and wine and sauté <b>3 min/120°C//speed 1<b>, <b>without measuring cup<b>.
Add mushrooms, salt and peppper and cook <b>5 min/120°C//speed 1<b>, <b>without measuring cup<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cream and cook <b>2 min/120°C//speed 1<b>, <b>without measuring cup<b> or until thickened.
Serve mushroom sauce over reserved dumplings and garnish with chives to serve.
